title: No Modernism without Lesbians, with Dianna Souhami
itunes:title: No Modernism without Lesbians, with Dianna Souhami
description:
Dianna Souhami has worked for decades as a chronicler of sexual subcultures in early 20th century Europe, and finally, she is allowed to deliver her thesis: without this network of lesbians, the parties they through and the lovers they supported, modernism would not have been possible. She speaks with Jessa about our limited ideas of creativity and genius, why rewriting history is still important, and the lifelong project of lineage. 

(This will be the final episode with Jessa Crispin as host.)

http://patreon.com/publicintellectual
